title: Expert Council on Well-Being and AI
optimized_headline: "Discover Insights from the Expert Council on AI and Well-Being"
raw_excerpt: OpenAI’s new Expert Council on Well-Being and AI brings together leading psychologists, clinicians, and researchers to guide how ChatGPT supports emotional health, especially for teens. Learn how their insights are shaping safer, more caring AI experiences.
raw_body: OpenAI’s new Expert Council on Well-Being and AI brings together leading psychologists, clinicians, and researchers to guide how ChatGPT supports emotional health, especially for teens. Learn how their insights are shaping safer, more caring AI experiences.
speedrun: OpenAI has launched an Expert Council on Well-Being and AI, consisting of top psychologists and researchers. Their mission is to ensure that ChatGPT effectively supports emotional health, particularly for teenagers. This initiative highlights a growing recognition of the need for AI to be more mindful of mental health. As AI tools become more integrated into daily life, fostering safe and supportive interactions is increasingly important.
why_it_matters: This initiative directly impacts teens, aiming to create a safer environment for their emotional well-being through better AI interactions.
It signals a broader trend in the tech industry towards prioritizing mental health in AI development, reflecting societal concerns about digital interactions.

lenses.eli12: OpenAI is working with experts to make ChatGPT a safer friend for teens. Think of it like having a caring teacher who knows how to talk to students about their feelings. This effort is important because it could help young people feel more supported when using technology.
lenses.pm: For product managers, this means there's a growing user need for AI that understands and supports emotional health. By focusing on this area, companies could improve user engagement and trust. It's crucial to consider how product features can enhance mental well-being.
lenses.engineer: The formation of this Expert Council emphasizes the need for AI systems to be developed with a focus on emotional intelligence. Incorporating insights from psychology could lead to models that better understand and respond to users' mental health needs. This approach may require new benchmarks to assess AI interactions in sensitive contexts.
